name: Crab and Asparagus Soup
author: Emily Tisdale
summary: An Asian-inspired soup that is decadent and rich.  Perfect for a cold winter day and elegant enough for special holidays.  I make this every year at our Christmas gathering, usually doubling the recipe, and my daughter always claims the leftovers to take home.
ingredients: 1 pound asparagus spears, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
directions: Combine shrimp stock and ginger in a large saucepan over medium-high heat
Stir in asparagus and reduce heat to medium
Cover and simmer until asparagus are partially cooked, about 3 minutes
Combine cornstarch and water in a small bowl
Stir sesame oil and soy sauce into soup
Simmer, stirring constantly, until soup thickens, about 1 minute
Slowly add beaten egg, while gently stirring soup to form threads of cooked egg
Stir in crab meat and simmer until crab is thoroughly heated, about 5 minutes
